meanings.definition: A person who crams for an exam.
meanings.sent1: The crammer stayed up all night studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: During finals week, many students become crammers.
meanings.sent3: The crammer forgot their textbook and had to rely on memory.
meanings.sent4: She was a human crammer, absorbing information like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crammer with books piled high is unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A study session that involves intense, last-minute preparation.
meanings.sent1: The students had a crammer before the big exam.
meanings.sent2: Last night's crammer helped him pass the quiz.
meanings.sent3: The crammer turned into a group study session with snacks.
meanings.sent4: The crammer was a whirlwind of papers and highlighters.
meanings.sent5: The crammer session was a frenzy of activity and stress.

meanings.definition: A tool used to pack or fill tightly.
meanings.sent1: He used a crammer to compress the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter's crammer was essential for the job.
meanings.sent3: The crammer made the suitcase bulge with clothes.
meanings.sent4: The crammer pushed the ingredients firmly into the mold.
meanings.sent5: The crammer ensured the box was tightly sealed.
